intro: Athronia, commonly known as the golden bellviolet, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. They are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. Athronia species typically grow as annual or biennial herbs with opposite leaves and often thrive in well-drained soils. Their ornamental value makes them popular in gardens and landscaping.
